name: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users.
supplemental_guidance: Non-organizational users include system users other than organizational users explicitly covered by IA-02. Non-organizational users are uniquely identified and authenticated for accesses other than those explicitly identified and documented in AC-14. Identification and authentication of non-organizational users accessing federal systems may be required to protect federal, proprietary, or privacy-related information.

rev5.name: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
rev5.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users.
rev5.discussion: Non-organizational users include system users other than organizational users explicitly covered by IA-02. Non-organizational users are uniquely identified and authenticated for accesses other than those explicitly identified and documented in AC-14. Identification and authentication of non-organizational users accessing federal systems may be required to protect federal, proprietary, or privacy-related information.

attack_techniques.name: Scheduled Task/Job
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users before granting system access prevents external adversaries from creating scheduled tasks without first establishing a verified identity.

attack_techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication of non-organizational users before system access prevents unauthenticated external actors from executing commands through scripting interpreters on organizational systems.

attack_techniques.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users accessing public-facing applications adds an identity verification layer that limits anonymous exploitation of application vulnerabilities for initial access.

attack_techniques.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication of external users accessing remote services prevents unauthenticated adversaries from exploiting internal service vulnerabilities for lateral movement.

attack_techniques.name: Data from Information Repositories
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users before granting access to information repositories prevents anonymous data collection from wikis, SharePoint, and other knowledge bases.

attack_techniques.name: Steal Application Access Token
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Enforcing strong authentication for non-organizational API consumers limits adversaries' ability to steal and abuse application access tokens issued to external partners.

attack_techniques.name: Data from Cloud Storage
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users accessing cloud storage and enforcing identity verification prevents anonymous access to cloud-hosted organizational data.

attack_techniques.name: Transfer Data to Cloud Account
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication for all cloud data transfer operations ensures that non-organizational adversaries cannot anonymously transfer data to external cloud accounts.

attack_techniques.name: Cloud Service Dashboard
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users accessing cloud dashboards prevents unauthorized external actors from discovering cloud infrastructure through unauthenticated console access.

attack_techniques.name: Pre-OS Boot
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring strong authentication for firmware and boot configuration interfaces ensures non-organizational users cannot modify pre-OS boot mechanisms without verified identity.

attack_techniques.name: Container Orchestration Job
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users accessing container orchestration platforms prevents external adversaries from scheduling container jobs without verified identity credentials.

attack_techniques.name: PowerShell
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication for remote PowerShell access ensures non-organizational users cannot execute PowerShell commands on organizational systems without verified identity.

attack_techniques.name: Network Device CLI
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users accessing network device CLIs prevents external adversaries from executing device commands without verified identity credentials.

attack_techniques.name: Cloud Account
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication before cloud directory access prevents non-organizational users from anonymously enumerating cloud accounts and discovering organizational identities.

attack_techniques.name: Confluence
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating non-organizational users before Confluence access prevents external adversaries from anonymously browsing wiki content and collecting sensitive organizational information.

attack_techniques.name: Sharepoint
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication for SharePoint access ensures non-organizational users cannot anonymously access document libraries and harvest organizational data.

attack_techniques.name: Customer Relationship Management Software
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating external users accessing CRM platforms prevents adversaries from anonymously extracting customer relationship data from organizational CRM systems.

attack_techniques.name: Messaging Applications
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication for messaging application access prevents non-organizational users from accessing organizational communications without verified identity.

attack_techniques.name: System Firmware
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating access to firmware update interfaces ensures that non-organizational users cannot modify system BIOS or UEFI firmware without verified credentials.

attack_techniques.name: Bootkit
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring authentication for bootloader configuration access prevents non-organizational users from installing bootkits without establishing verified system access.

attack_techniques.name: TFTP Boot
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Authenticating TFTP boot server access and requiring identity verification for network boot configurations prevents external adversaries from redirecting device boot processes.

attack_techniques.name: Kernel Modules and Extensions
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Requiring strong authentication for kernel module loading operations prevents non-organizational users from installing unauthorized kernel modules without verified privileged access.

metadata.review_notes: Generated from NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 with compliance mappings from framework-coverage data
